intro: Halimolobos weddellii var. herrerae, commonly known as the Weddell's halimolobos, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
